bite: On 4 February 2021, employees of several concert halls protested in Chisinau, demanding the lifting of the coronavirus restrictions from their venues. [size=no report]
PSRM: Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova; Government of Moldova (2020-)

On 3 February 2021, at least 11 PSRM youth activists and councillors protested in Chisinau - Buiucani, demanding the resignation of the presidential advisor on health over her alleged falsification of a degree certificate. [size=at least 11]
Civic Congress (Moldova); PAS: Party of Action and Solidarity; Government of Moldova (2020-)

On 3 February 2021, several dozen people protested outside the government building in Chisinau - Buiucani, condemning the illegality of a recently formed commission for examining national heritage and the affirmative vote for the construction of a tall building near two historical buildings. A Civic Congress leader and a PAS MP participated in the protest. [size=several dozen]

On 1 February 2021, demonstrators in support of the victims of domestic violence barged in the town council in Chirsova, calling the mayor corrupt and verbally insulting his son. A fight broke out between several demonstrators on one side and the mayor, his deputy, and the mayor's son, on the other side. The mayor had a minor injury above his eye. [size=no report]
PSRM: Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova; Government of Moldova (2020-)

On 31 January 2021, around 400 people, including two PSRM MPs, protested in Balti, demanding the protection of the Russian language in Moldova and condemning the Constitutional Court's decision to dismiss a law giving Russian a special minority status in the country. [size=around 400]

On 27 January 2021, several people protested outside the Justice Ministry in Chisinau - Buiucani, demanding justice in high-profile corruption cases and the revision of the Constitution. Some protesters blocked a street, entered into minor scuffles between themselves. One protester was detained for a short time. [size=several]
On 26 January 2021, locals of 4 villages protested in Comrat over the region authorities' decision to not allocate any money for capital investment in the respective villages. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, around 30 people protested outside a court in Comrat, demanding cooperation with the judiciary in a case involving an attack on the prosecutor's office. [size=around 30]

On 25 January 2021, several farmers protested outside the Interior Ministry in Chisinau - Centru, complaining over the citations and fines offered for their protests in December 2020. A PDA leader participated in the protest. [size=several]
On 25 January 2021, a PDA leader was hit several times by a forester while filming the alleged transportation of illegally logged wood from the Plaiul Fagului reservation near Bahmut.

On 23 January 2021, tens of people protested outside the Russian Embassy in Chisinau - Buiucani demanding the release of Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny. Another group showed support to Vladimir Putin's regime in the Navalny case. [size=tens]

On 22 January 2021, unidentified individuals set on fire the house of the mayor of Merenii Noi. The mayor belonging to Our Party was found unconscious in the house and it is rumored that he was attacked.

Another group protested to support the inclusion of the Russian language as the second language in Moldova's administration. [size=no report]

A farmer ploughed a piece of land in the nearby park. [size=around 200]

Property destruction: On 18 December 2020, an individual set on fire two cars belonging to a farmer in Causeni. The farmer is known for his leadership in the farmers' protests in December 2020.

On 18 December 2020, farmers protested in Chisinau-Buiucani, demanding compensation for their losses caused by droughts and a decrease in VAT in 2021. Bus drivers and workers from the hospitality and restaurant sectors joined the protest in solidarity with the farmers' demands, complaining about the 2021 budget law. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2020, tens of farmers protested outside the parliament in Chisinau-Buiucani, demanding better compensation for their losses due to droughts and the decrease of the VAT in 2021. Our Party members and a PPDA vice-president took part in the protest. [size=tens]
On 17 December 2020, tens of locals protested in Lapusna by blocking a national road, condemning the takeover of the village council's building by a former councillor. [size=tens]

Other: On 16 December 2020, the Moldovan Parliament adopted the 2021 budget law, a law on cancelling government's contribution to National Bank's 2014 loans to the defrauded banks, a law on lowering the retirement age, a law on lifting restrictions on Russian TV channels broadcasting in the country, as well as a law forcing state institutions to use Russian when requested by citizens. The law was adopted with serious procedural violations.

On 16 December 2020, tens of farmers demonstrated outside the Moldovan Parliament in Chisinau-Buiucani, demanding better compensation for their losses caused by droughts and a decrease of the VAT in 2021. Farmers pushed through police rows with their tractors, injuring four police officers who had to be hospitalized. Police, in their turn, used teargas against farmers, but hit a journalist, too. PAS and PPDA MPs joined the farmers and demanded the police let several demonstrators to enter the parliament building for negotiations. [size=tens]

On 15 December 2020, farmers protested outside the government building in Chisinau-Buiucani, demanding the resignation of the Agriculture Minister and the entire cabinet, compensation for their losses caused by droughts and a decrease in VAT for 2021. The farmers attempted to enter the government building, but were prevented by the police. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2020, farmers protested outside the government building in Chisinau-Buiucani, demanding to talk with the government on the compensation for their losses caused by droughts and a decrease in VAT for 2021. [size=no report]

On 9 December 2020, around 150 farmers protested with their tractors outside the government building in Chisinau-Buiucani, demanding the payment of higher compensations for their losses during the 2020 droughts and the planning of more fiscal facilities in the 2021 budget law. [size=around 150]

On 6 December 2020, around 20000 people protested in Chisinau-Buiucani against the controversial laws adopted by the parliament concerning the security services, the use of minority languages, the Gagauz autonomy, and the 2021 budget. The protesters also demanded snap parliamentary elections. President-elect Maia Sandu, mayors, PAS MPs, PPDA MPs, Our Party members, PDM MPs, PL members, Pro Moldova MPs, PUN members and one PUN MP, as well as Transnistrian war veterans, ethnic Gagauz people, and farmers, took part in the rally. [size=around 20000]

Elections/referendum: On 29 November 2020, elections for the Tiraspol-based local parliament took place in Transnistria, with 31 out of 33 mandates won by Obnovlenie party members or affiliates. The outcome of the election consolidated the control of the Sheriff group over the region.

PAS: Party of Action and Solidarity

Elections/referendum: On 15 November 2020, Maia Sandu was elected as president of Moldova. Even though the position is largely symbolic, the powers coming with it can enable a new reform agenda in Chisinau and develop different foreign relations and relations with the breakaway region of Transnistria.

Arrests: Around 7 October 2020, four men, including one Moldovan policeman and a government employee, were arrested in Sanatauca and Camenca by the Transnistrian state security ministry, over alleged charges of high treason, spying in favor of Moldova's constitutional authorities, and other crimes. The policeman and the government employee were released on 8 October, after negotiations between Chisinau and Tiraspol, but were restricted from leaving Transnistria. On 19 October 2020, the arrested policeman returned to his workplace in the Moldovan Police.

The man was later transported to the Transnistrian region for detention by the separatist authorities in a case with an unknown sentence. It is unclear if the police acted with the authorization of any senior officials or were bribed or pressured by Transnistrian leadership.
